@EYEWAREi @dbokser That is interesting - not sure I following you completely, the conflict you are sketching are very much on my mind
@EYEWAREi @dbokser Please elaborate
@EYEWAREi @dbokser Yes. Games are changing shape both as business and medium these years, quite substantially I think
@dbokser @EYEWAREi Good point. I hear the dying industry thing expressed a lot - guess it refers retail+aaa approach, not the whole industry
@dbokser @EYEWAREi LOL :D
@Lucid00 I like that way of putting it - I'm just leaning towards "doomed" instead of "unsure"...
@EYEWAREi @dbokser The art statement is just my own humble opinion :)
@EYEWAREi @dbokser Just heard that retail revenue has been halved in the last four years... The old approach is having a hard time.
Videogames as an industry may be dying, but as an art it is thriving.
When artists get together they talk about where you can buy cheap turpentine." - Pablo Picasso [2/2]
"When art critics get together they talk about Form and Structure and Meaning. [1/2]
